page.title: 05UPPER DOUNREAY FARM
page.content: Upper Dounreay:_ A large farm taken over by the government in 1920 and broken up into small holdings to rent to farm workers or others trying to begin a career in farming. After the 1939/45 war some of these small farms were paired. By 1985 the smallholders have by law been able to buy their farms and to sell them. One can can see the former large farm of Upper Dounreay being put together by purchase and amalgamation. The land is similar to Isauld and is very good Caithness soil with similar cropping potential.The high cost today of farm machinery makes it very difficult for a young man to begin farming himself and is hastening the demise of small farms as viable units. We are thus seeing the end of an experiment in social farming and this will further empty the countryside of people.
